blogroll.name: Katy DeCorah
blogroll.note: Blogs about web development and life. Katy has provided lots of inspiration for how I build parts of Flamed Fury.

blogroll.name: Cory Dransfeldt
blogroll.note: Whenever I want to do something on my website, I check to see if Cory has already done it.

blogroll.name: Robb Knight
blogroll.note: If Cory hasn't done what I'm looking to do, then Robb is my next stop.

blogroll.name: Kevin Powell
blogroll.note: Helping you learn how to make the web, and make it look good while you're at it.

blogroll.name: Chris Coyier
blogroll.note: Blogs about blogging, web development and life.

blogroll.name: Oh Hello Ana
blogroll.note: Blogs about blogging, web development and life. Shares great bookmarks.

blogroll.name: The Cheapskates Guide to Computers and the Internet
blogroll.note: Essays about the otherside of the Internet with a focus on low cost computing.

blogroll.name: Localghost
blogroll.note: Fun website. Blogs about tech, web development and mental health

blogroll.name: Jim Nielsen's Blog
blogroll.note: Blogs about interesting things about the web.

blogroll.name: Manuel Moreale
blogroll.note: Blogs about tech, the web and disconnecting.

blogroll.name: Stephanie Eckles
blogroll.note: Blogs about web development and has a great set of development resources.

blogroll.name: Kevin Powell
blogroll.note: Helping you learn how to make the web, and make it look good while you're at it.

webDevelopment.name: MDN Web Docs
webDevelopment.note: A complete set of articles aims to guide complete beginners to web development with all that they need to start coding websites.

webDevelopment.name: Smashing Magazine
webDevelopment.note: Magazine on CSS, JavaScript, front-end, accessibility, UX and design. For developers, designers and front-end engineers.

webDevelopment.name: CodePen
webDevelopment.note: An online code editor, learning environment, and community for front-end web development using HTML, CSS and JavaScript code snippets, projects, and web applications.

webDevelopment.name: Every Layout
webDevelopment.note: Through a series of simple, composable layouts, Every Layout will teach you how to better harness the built-in algorithms that power browsers and CSS.

webDevelopment.name: Utopia
webDevelopment.note: Fluid responsive design for your websites.

webDevelopment.name: 11ty
webDevelopment.note: Eleventy, a simpler static site generator.

webDevelopment.name: 11tybundle
webDevelopment.note: Weekly posts full of 11ty resources from across the web.

webDevelopment.name: 11ty Rocks!
webDevelopment.note: A collection of Eleventy (11ty) starters, projects, plugins, and resources by Stephanie Eckles.

webDevelopment.name: SmolCSS
webDevelopment.note: Minimal snippets for modern CSS layouts and components by Stephanie Eckles.

webDevelopment.name: Modern CSS
webDevelopment.note: A series examining modern CSS solutions to problems by Stephanie Eckles.

webDevelopment.name: HTML Recipes
webDevelopment.note: A collection of quick copy HTML snippets for a variety of common scenarios by Stephanie Eckles.

webDevelopment.name: SitePoint
webDevelopment.note: Learn Web Design & Development with SitePoint tutorials, courses and books

newsLetters.name: The History Of the Web
newsLetters.note: The best stories from the web's history.

newsLetters.name: Kevin Powell's Newsletter
newsLetters.note: Updates, little tips & tricks, and awesome resources from Kevin Powell.

newsLetters.name: People and Blogs
newsLetters.note: People and Blogs is a weekly newsletter by Manuel Moreale, where he asks interesting people to talk about themselves and their blogs.

newsLetters.name: Own Your Web
newsLetters.note: A newsletter by Matthias Ott about designing, building, creating, and publishing for and on the Web.

newsLetters.name: Webworm with David Farrier
newsLetters.note: David Farrier's stories from the weird side of the Internet.

podCasts.name: The Real Pod presents: Remember When
podCasts.note: Aotearoa Specific. Revisit New Zealand's pop culture past with Jane Yee, Duncan Greive and Alex Casey.

podCasts.name: Rebel FM
podCasts.note: My gaming fix. They play games and talk about them, their lives, and how the two intersect. Usually. And there are jokes..

podCasts.name: Darknet Diaries
podCasts.note: Stories from the dark side of the Internet. A podcast about hackers, breaches, shadow government activity, hacktivism, cybercrime, and all the things that dwell on the hidden parts of the network. This is Darknet Diaries.

podCasts.name: Shop Talk Show
podCasts.note: A weekly podcast about building websites from Dave Rupert and Chris Coyier.

searchEngines.name: Kagi
searchEngines.note: Kagi is a paid search product. It is also a fast, private search engine that provides results that have your best interests in mind. I'm paying for it and using it as my default search.

searchEngines.name: Marginalia Search
searchEngines.note: An independent search engine that favours text-heavy websites. Focuses on non-commercial content, and attempts to show you sites you perhaps weren't aware of in favor of the sort of sites you probably already knew existed.

searchEngines.name: searchmystite
searchEngines.notes: The searchmysite.net search engine is a niche search, focussing on the "indieweb" or "small web" or "digital gardens", i.e. non-commercial content, primarily personal and independent websites.

searchEngines.name: Wiby
searchEngines.notes: Wiby is a search engine for older style pages, lightweight and based on a subject of interest. Building a web more reminiscent of the early internet.

searchEngines.name: Gibiru
searchEngines.notes: Uncensored private search engine. They exist to provide access to information outside of big tech's censorship bubble and do so privately.

searchEngines.name: Infotiger
searchEngines.notes: Independent, privacy respecting search engine. Building their own index, sitting at around 300 million english websites indexed.

searchEngines.name: Brave Search
searchEngines.notes: Brave as a company aside, they claim that they do not filter, downrank or censor search results. They are building their own index of the Web so they do not rely on Google or Bing results.

webDirectories.name: ooh.directory
webDirectories.notes: A collection of 2084+ blogs about every topic.

webDirectories.name: Ye Olde Blogroll
webDirectories.notes: A humanly curated list of fine personal & independent blogs that are updated regularly. No algorithms ever!

webDirectories.name: personalsit.es
webDirectories.notes: A site to share and revel in personal websites.

webDirectories.name: i.webthings directory
webDirectories.notes: A hand curated directory of websites to explore with a focus on the independent and noncommercial web.

webDirectories.name: Kagi Small Web
webDirectories.notes: A Stumble Upon like web surfing experience.
